function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Malaria risk mapping and prediction based on spatial covariates, vegetation amounts, and population density.","Impact":"Inaccurate predictions may lead to misallocation of resources or inadequate control measures, increasing the risk of malaria transmission.","Mitigation":"Validation of model predictions using on-ground surveillance data, integration of additional relevant environmental factors, and continuous model refinement based on new data.","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis, machine learning algorithms, and remote sensing technologies for data collection.","People":"Public health authorities, epidemiologists, and researchers working on malaria control and prevention.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies, and government health departments."},{"Description":"Analysis of population mobility patterns and trends in Namibia, revealing shorter distance movements and increasing phone usage.","Impact":"Incomplete understanding of human mobility patterns may affect the effectiveness of interventions and disease control strategies, potentially contributing to the spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Integration of mobility data into disease spread models, development of targeted intervention strategies based on population movement patterns, and implementation of communication strategies to reach mobile populations.","Technologies":"Data analytics, mobile phone tracking, and geographic information systems (GIS) for spatial analysis.","People":"Public health agencies, epidemiologists, and policy makers involved in disease control efforts.","Owner":"Government health departments, research institutions, and telecommunications companies."}]}
